name: project_charter
description: Formal project charter following PM methodology

inputs.label: Project Title
inputs.description: A clear, concise name for your project

inputs.label: Department/Organization
inputs.description: Department or organization sponsoring this project

inputs.label: Project Goal
inputs.description: Overall project goal and desired outcome
inputs.placeholder: Generate concise, data-driven monthly productivity highlight emails for facility partners that compare service-line performance fairly and inform collaborative staffing decisions.

inputs.label: Success Criteria
inputs.placeholder:
- Emails are exactly 3 paragraphs (~200-300 words)
- All metrics are accurate and sourced from JSON data
- Apples-to-apples comparisons only (ICU vs ICU, Floor vs Floor)
- Neutral, partnership-focused tone (no facility rankings)
- Partners request clarifications or take staffing actions

inputs.label: Business Need
inputs.description: Problem, need, or opportunity being addressed
inputs.placeholder: Leadership and partners need a concise, monthly view of service-line productivity to calibrate staffing and support collaborative decision-making without facility-to-facility competition.

inputs.label: Desired Outcomes
inputs.placeholder:
- Trusted, repeatable monthly reporting
- Faster staffing conversations anchored in shared facts
- Reduced email drafting time (target < 5 minutes)
- Clear visibility into ICU vs Floor trends

inputs.label: Problem/Opportunity Definition
inputs.placeholder: We track productivity across multiple facility classes and service lines. Current email updates are ad-hoc and time-consuming, and risk unfair comparisons. We need a neutral, apples-to-apples monthly pulse that converts JSON data into a concise email.

inputs.label: Proposed Solution
inputs.placeholder: Use a Productivity Pulse Email blueprint that accepts JSON service-line data, enforces 3-paragraph output, ensures apples-to-apples comparisons, and uses neutral language. Integrate Task & Purpose to maintain focus.

inputs.label: Strategic Alignment
inputs.placeholder: Supports data-driven decision-making, strengthens facility partnerships, and standardizes communication cadence (monthly).

inputs.label: Selection Criteria
inputs.description: Why this solution was selected over alternatives

inputs.label: Measurable Benefits
inputs.description: Quantifiable improvements expected from this project
inputs.placeholder:
- Reduce time to draft monthly update to < 5 minutes
- Increase partner engagement (replies with questions/adjustments)
- Fewer back-and-forth clarification emails
- Improved trust in data via consistent sourcing

inputs.label: Cost/Benefit Analysis
inputs.default: To be completed during planning phase

inputs.label: Scope
inputs.description: What is in and out of scope
inputs.placeholder: In scope: monthly productivity email generation, JSON parsing, chart references, distribution process. Out of scope: automated chart generation, facility-to-facility rankings, unrelated service lines.

inputs.label: Major Deliverables
inputs.placeholder:
- Email subject line
- Opening paragraph
- Metrics & highlights paragraph
- Closing paragraph
- Chart descriptions list
- Lessons learned note after each send

inputs.label: Risks & Mitigation
inputs.description: Detailed risk assessment and mitigation strategies

inputs.label: Initial Risks & Assumptions
inputs.placeholder: Assumptions: consistent JSON format; partners prefer neutral language. Risks: data quality issues; misinterpretation without apples-to-apples framing.

inputs.label: Schedule Overview
inputs.placeholder:
- Generate pulse by the 30th of each month
- Stakeholder review within 48 hours
- Send to partners by the 3rd business day
- Log lessons learned after send

inputs.label: High-Level Requirements
inputs.placeholder:
- Accept JSON service-line breakdown input
- Enforce 3-paragraph email output
- Ensure apples-to-apples comparisons
- Support chart descriptions in closing
- Store sent emails as artifacts (memory)

inputs.label: Collaboration Needs
inputs.placeholder:
- Operations: monthly data export
- Partners: feedback on highlights
- IT: data access and storage
- Admin: distribution list management

verification_questions.question: Does the charter clearly articulate the business need or opportunity?
verification_questions.remediation_hint: Expand the Business Need section to describe the current problem/gap, why it matters, and how it ties to strategic goals.

verification_questions.question: Are success criteria specific and measurable?
verification_questions.remediation_hint: Revise success criteria to include specific metrics, targets, and measurement methods.

verification_questions.question: Is the project scope clearly defined with explicit boundaries?
verification_questions.remediation_hint: Add explicit statements about what IS and IS NOT included in project scope.

verification_questions.question: Are risks identified with appropriate mitigation strategies?
verification_questions.remediation_hint: For each identified risk, provide likelihood, impact, and specific mitigation actions.

verification_questions.question: Does the proposed solution align with the stated strategic goals?
verification_questions.remediation_hint: Explicitly connect the proposed solution to specific strategic objectives mentioned in the alignment section.

criteria.name: Completeness
criteria.description: All required sections present with sufficient detail
